questions.text: Which of the following hormones regulates rum calcium levels?

A 54-year-old chronic alcoholic patient presents with altered sensorium and confusion. He also complains of weakness in both lower limbs and occasional tingling in his legs. His staple diet includes white polished rice. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old patient was brought to the emergency room by his relatives in a state of agitation, impaired judgment, and combativeness. His spot blood glucose level was 45 mg/dL. Yesterday, the patient went to the gym directly after work, following which he attended a party where he only consumed alcoholic beverages and skipped his meals. Which of the following is the likely cause of hypoglycemia in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased NADH/NAD+ ratio leads to hypoglycemia.

questions.text: A patient came to the clinic, and the following test was performed, as shown in the image below. Which of the following is being tested here?

A child was defecating in the open in a village when he was attacked by pack of dogs. One of the attacking dogs was found dead the next day. Considering the high risk of rabies in the child he was admitted to District hospital and was given antirabiesserum (ARS) and Rabipur vaccine. A 50-year-old male presented with diarrhoea for a few weeks. His family members report observing abnormal behaviour that they had not noticed earlier. Recently, he has developed a rash around his neck, as shown below. This rash flares up when exposed to sunlight. Which of the following supplements is most likely to benefit the patient?

A 50-year-old man with a history of repeated pain over the medial canthus and chronic use of nasal decongestants presents to the OPD with high-grade fever, chills, headache, and bilateral proptosis. On eliciting further history, it was confirmed that proptosis began in the right eye, and a few days later, the left eye was also affected. Fundoscopy reveals papilloedema. In the given left ventricular pressure-volume loop, which of the following corresponds to the ‘c’ wave of JVP?
questions.correct_answer: B. Point B to Point C

options.text: Decrease in bowman’s capsule hydrostatic pressure

questions.text: A 16-year-old patient presents with diarrhoea and pellagra-like photosensitive skin eruptions for the last 5 years. Her vital examinations are normal. Urine analysis reveals an increase in the amino acid levels but normal levels of 5-hydroxyindole acetic acid (5-HIAA). What is the likely diagnosis?

A young man presents to the ER with complaints of sudden onset nausea, vomiting, and four episodes of rice watery diarrhea. He gives a history of having food from a nearby bakery 2 days ago. Selective culture media is shown below. Identify the likely organism.

A patient presents to the ER with complaints of headache, seizures and blurred vision. His BP was recorded as 220/120 mmHg. Which of the following will be the next best step in the management of this patient?

A 50-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a unilateral throbbing headache associated with nausea and vomiting. She has had similar episodes in the past where the headache usually lasts for 1-2 days, and she prefers sitting in a dark room during the attacks. She also gives a history of a myocardial infarction 2 years ago. Which of the following drugs cannot be prescribed to this patient to treat this condition?

A lumbar puncture was performed that showed Protein 1.0 g/L, glucose 2.2 mmol/L, white cell count 150/mm3, 90% polymorphs. On microscopy the organism was noted to have differential motility i.e tumbling motility at 25° and non-motile at 37°. Identify the organism

What is the likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Metastatic calcification with normal serum calcium level

options.label: B
options.text: Metastatic calcification with increased serum calcium level

options.label: C
options.text: Dystrophic calcification with normal serum calcium level

options.label: D
options.text: Dystrophic calcification with increased serum calcium level

questions.correct_answer: C. Dystrophic calcification with normal serum calcium level

A 33-year-old male met with a road traffic accident. There is persistent watery discharge mixed with blood from his nose for 3 days which cannot be sniffed back. Which of the following should not be done in this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Bed rest and avoiding strenuous activity

questions.correct_answer: B. Plan surgical treatment with functional endoscopic sinus surgery

questions.text: A 65-year-old female patient presented with. Sudden painless loss of vision. She has been a known diabetic for 12 years. Ophthalmoscopy shows evidence of loss of fundal features, floating debris and a dark red glow. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Iron and folic acid if the Hb <11 g/dl

options.label: B
options.text: Iron and folic acid if the Hb <9 g/dl

options.label: C
options.text: Iron and folic acid only in 3rd trimester

options.label: D
options.text: Iron and folic acid for 6 months antepartum and for 6 months postpartum

questions.correct_answer: D. Iron and folic acid for 6 months antepartum and for 6 months postpartum

questions.text: The World health organisation (WHO) definition of blindness is

options.label: A
options.text: Best corrected visual acuity of less than 1/60 in the better eye

options.label: B
options.text: Best corrected visual acuity of less than 3/60 in the better eye

options.label: C
options.text: Presenting visual acuity of worse than 3/60 in the better eye

options.label: D
options.text: Presenting visual acuity of worse than 6/60 in the better eye

questions.correct_answer: C. Presenting visual acuity of worse than 3/60 in the better eye

The patient had a history of flashing lights and floaters 7 days back. He also gives a history of having cataract surgery in the same eye 3 weeks ago. What is the likely cause of this condition?

What does the term “tracking” refer to in relation to blood pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Observing changes in blood pressure throughout a 24-hour period

options.label: B
options.text: Recording and analyzing blood pressure levels over an extended period to identify patterns and predict future readings

options.label: C
options.text: Comparing blood pressure values between different populations based on demographics

options.label: D
options.text: Assessing blood pressure during exercise to evaluate cardiovascular health

questions.correct_answer: B. Recording and analyzing blood pressure levels over an extended period to identify patterns and predict future readings

A 20-year-old pregnant female presents with conductive hearing loss of 54db, not associated with tinnitus. Pure tone audiometry shows a notch at 2000 Hz. Which of the following is correct regarding the pathophysiology of the disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Ossicular fixation with intact tympanic membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Ossicular fixation with perforated tympanic membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Erosion of stapes footplate with perforated tympanic membrane

questions.correct_answer: B. Ossicular fixation with perforated tympanic membrane

options.label: A

questions.correct_answer: A. Nasopharyngeal swab for SARS CoV2 testing

questions.text: Following the death of a person, his family who lived abroad was unable to reach him, and hence his body needed to be preserved. Which of the following substances can typically be detected in his body, even if the person did not consume the substance shortly before death?

A 15-year-old boy presents to the ER with complaints of muscle twitching and tremors. He gives a history of consuming crushed seeds from a plant. Shortly after, he begins to experience refractory seizures and assumes a characteristic posture with. Arching of the back and rigid extension of the limbs. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old child presented with complaints of headache and blurring of vision. On examination, there was a difference in visual acuity. In the right eye, it was (+5D) and in the left, it was (+1D). After the best possible correction for vision, visual acuity in the right eye is 6/18 and in the left is 6/24. On fundoscopy, no pathology could be appreciated. What is the likely diagnosis?

A construction site worker is brought to emergency with complaints of excessive redness and watering in the right eye. He gave a history of some chemical that had accidentally fallen into his eye few hours back. Which of the following treatment options is best suited for this patient?

An exclusively breastfed 3-month-old baby was brought with complaints of lethargy, vomiting and diarrhoea. Further examination confirmed the presence of jaundice, hypotonia and hepatomegaly. Ocular examination revealed a bilateral cataract that resembled a drop of oil. What is the most likely diagnosis?
